item.description: Flexible, adaptable and self developing with an aptitude for picking up ICT systems and techniques (For example I am currently learning JAVA and XUL for two personal projects).
Good training and development skills ranging from identifying learners needs to preparing sessions and giving feedback and assessment.
A keen free and open source software advocate who contributes to and leads various small FOSS projects.
A skilled programmer with over 5 years experience in web technologies especially PHP, HTML and JavaScript.
Dedicated to bringing the most efficient and usable user experience to new and existing systems, by bring forward innovative ideas and developing them into complete systems.
A hardworking individual with experience of working in small teams as well as written, verbal and visual communication.

Good awareness of design, planning & problem solving techniques and approaches in a variety of situations from developing functional specifications for technical solutions with users, to process development, training, team and capacity building.

Flexible, adaptable and self developing with an aptitude for picking up ICT systems and techniques (I am currently learning JAVA for 3D games development and XUL for an Internet aware song lyric and presentation projection suite).
Good training and development skills ranging from identifying learners needs to preparing sessions and giving feedback and assessment.

Experience of high profile and high financial turnover environments, writing for systems with an annual turnover in excess of 14 million pounds and being the mostly responsible for the 'Flora London Marathon Exhibition' website.

Teaching workshops with Access-Space users new to Linux and FOSS on how to choose install and configure a GNU/Linux distribution, using course notes I wrote in preparation (http://knowhow.access-space.org/wiki/doku.php?id=courses:ilit).
Teaching some users the parts of a PC and how to select build and test PCs from component parts, also constructing PCs to train on.
Sharing knowledge of Open Source Software utilities and tools (and the ethos behind them) for development with other users including creativity programs, editors and programming libraries.
Assisting in the creation of various Access-Space Web pages including modifying HTML templates for dokuwiki.
Software Developer on TAMS (Total Agency Management System) which provides back office and public websites for booking accommodation and conference facilities and equipment and exhibition space.
Worked closely with internal and external customers identifying, proposing and implementing new features to improve user experience.
Relational Database design and maintenance using PostgreSQL on a system comprising of well over 100 tables.
Developed major 'Hotel Booking Agency Management System' written in heavily object oriented PHP. Using an in house frame work that I helped to develop, this includes extensions to SMARTY.
Wrote and was responsible for design and maintenance of and user support for a user definable report writing module, which can output as HTML, CSV and PDF.

Wrote a cross browser rich Internet application for designing lettering for t-shirts and running vests for the Flora London Marathon, in object oriented JavaScript using JSON as the communication medium.
Wrote Web 2.0 style JavaScript rendered user interface elements for quick searches and situations where there are many small incremental updates to be made.
Built SVG plotter driver in PHP for HPGL2 based cutter plotters, used for taking T-Shirt lettering requests and cutting them out of vinyl.
Wrote graphical exhibition floor-plan designer in SVG and JavaScript.
Wrote a WYSIWYG user content system that, allowed Exhibitors at the Flora London Marathon to add there own content and logos to the lmexpo website safely.
Wrote XML / REST interfaces for connection to partner organisations systems, for single sign-in etc. And integration with Google Checkout and WorldPay
Designed and coded to unit tests for suitable areas of systems, ensuring further robustness.
Advised and assisted people on job search issues and help them to develop and find work.
Advised on the development of the externally developed Skills Register' system to fix it functionality and usability issues.

Developed tools to assist colleagues in other jobnets (15 offices around Sheffield) and JobCentrePlus offices to classify jobs in to the Standard Occupational Classification Codes, the first version being in CHM the second MS Access 2000 and the final one written in PHP.

Developed distributed systems to allow our advise workers to write CVs for clients, track the kind of work they are looking for and do semi automated job search on a number of websites, from any location. Again initially in ACCESS (as front end to PostgreSQL) but then in PHP.
Assistant Disability Employment Adviser.
Assisted disabled jobseekers to find work by advising on employment and benefit issues.
Occupational Psychology Assessment Test Administrator.
Administered Occupational Psychology Assessment exercises.
>Access to Work Administration Assistant / Assistant Access to Work Consultant.

Assisted the team to administer the programme. Due to Employment Services IT policy I had to develop a complex management information and reporting system in EXCEL, to replace the DiSC system. I was also asked to develop the Functional Specification for permanent the replacement DiSC2.

Managing all the internal information systems, developing 6 database systems, some of which loaded live data into our website using PERL, and others that were used for financial tracking, and reserve management.
Responsible for producing SWT's publications including the membership magazine Kingfisher and brochures.
Administered 10 PC network, installing software, training and coaching staff, advising SWT and others on purchasing, and trouble shooting.
Co-founder and developer for project aiming to use information technology to help socially excluded communities help themselves, through information, knowledge and resource sharing.
This involved putting together a draft Neighbourhood Atlas, a 250 page website.
Officer and Executive member for organisation that brings together over 70 community groups in the area to give local people a say in how regeneration funding is spent.

Also a member of the committee responsible for the use of European funding, and involved in writing the Area Action Plan and the organisation of the community conference and consultation on which it was based.
